SEARCH
Package storage

Class StorageServer

java.lang.Object
storage.StorageServer
public class StorageServer extends Object
Represents a storage server in a distributed file system. This server is responsible for handling file operations such as reading, writing, creating, deleting, and copying files. It interacts with a naming server to register itself and to make its file storage capabilities known to the system. The server provides a set of HTTP endpoints for file operations, which can be called by clients or other servers in the system. The storage server is designed to be run as a standalone service. Upon startup, it registers with the naming server, providing its IP, client port, command port, and a list of files it currently hosts. The server then listens for incoming HTTP requests to handle file operations. Each file operation is exposed as an HTTP endpoint, and the server uses Gson for JSON serialization/deserialization to facilitate communication. The server maintains a root directory where all files are stored and managed. This directory's path is specified at server startup. Key responsibilities include: - Registering with the naming server to announce its presence and file storage capabilities. - Handling file read requests, allowing clients to read file content. - Handling file write requests, allowing clients to write or modify file content. - Handling file creation requests, allowing clients to create new files. - Handling file delete requests, allowing clients to delete existing files. - Handling file copy requests, facilitating file replication across the distributed system. The storage server uses Java's built-in HTTP server capabilities and runs on two ports: one for handling client file operation requests (clientPort) and another for receiving commands from the naming server or other administrative tasks (commandPort).

  • Constructor Details

    • StorageServer

      public StorageServer(String namingServerHost, int namingServerRegistrationPort, int clientPort, int commandPort, String rootDirectory)
      Creates a new storage server with the specified configuration.
      Parameters:
      namingServerHost - Hostname or IP address of the naming server.
      namingServerRegistrationPort - Port on which the naming server listens for registration requests.
      clientPort - Port on which the storage server listens for client file operation requests.
      commandPort - Port on which the storage server listens for administrative commands.
      rootDirectory - Path to the root directory where files are stored.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start() throws IOException
      Starts the storage server, initializing the HTTP server to listen for incoming requests. The server listens on the client port for file operation requests and on the command port for administrative commands. Upon startup, the server registers itself with the naming server to announce its presence and file storage capabilities. The server then waits for incoming requests to handle file operations such as read, write, create, delete, and copy.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while starting the server or handling requests.

    • handleStorageCopy

      private void handleStorageCopy(HttpExchange exchange) throws IOException
      Processes a file copy request between storage servers. This endpoint extracts the file path, source server IP, and port from the request, then initiates a file copy. Responses vary based on operation success or failure, including file not found, invalid path, I/O errors, or interruptions during the copy process.
      Parameters:
      exchange - An HTTP exchange context containing the request and response details.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there's an issue with I/O operations during the request handling.

    • copyFileFromServer

      private boolean copyFileFromServer(String path, String storageIp, int port) throws IOException, InterruptedException, FileNotFoundException, IllegalArgumentException
      Copies a file from a remote server to the local storage. It first determines the size of the file to be copied by making a request to the remote server. Then, it creates a new file in the local storage and begins copying the file in chunks until the entire file has been transferred. If any part of the process fails (e.g., file not found, illegal arguments, or read errors), the method handles the exception by deleting the partially copied file and rethrowing the exception.
      Parameters:
      path - The relative path of the file to be copied, including its name.
      storageIp - The IP address of the remote storage server from which the file will be copied.
      port - The port number on the remote storage server used for the file transfer operation.
      Returns:
      true if the file copy operation is successful.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during communication with the remote server or writing to the file.
      InterruptedException - if the thread executing the request is interrupted.
      FileNotFoundException - if the file to be copied does not exist on the remote server.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided file path is invalid or leads to an illegal file operation.

    • getRemoteFileSize

      private long getRemoteFileSize(String path, String storageIp, int port) throws IOException, InterruptedException, FileNotFoundException, IllegalArgumentException
      Retrieves the size of a file from a remote storage server. This method sends an HTTP request to the specified storage server to obtain the size of the file located at the given path. It parses the response to extract the file size. If the server responds with an error or if the file does not exist, appropriate exceptions are thrown.
      Parameters:
      path - The path of the file whose size is to be determined.
      storageIp - The IP address of the remote storage server.
      port - The port number on which the remote storage server is listening.
      Returns:
      The size of the file in bytes.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during communication with the server.
      InterruptedException - If the operation is interrupted.
      FileNotFoundException - If the file does not exist on the remote server.
      IllegalArgumentException - If the server responds with an error indicating an invalid request.

    • handleStorageWrite

      private void handleStorageWrite(HttpExchange exchange) throws IOException
      Handles a write request to modify a file on the storage server. This method processes an incoming HTTP write request, extracting the file path, offset, and data from the request body. If the specified file exists and the provided path is valid, it writes the data to the file at the specified offset. Responses vary based on the operation's success or failure, including file not found, illegal path, or illegal offset errors.
      Parameters:
      exchange - The HTTP exchange context, containing the request and response details.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during the write operation or while sending the response.

    • handleStorageRead

      private void handleStorageRead(HttpExchange exchange) throws IOException
      Processes a read request for a file on the storage server. This method handles incoming HTTP read requests by parsing the request body for a file path, offset, and length. It verifies the existence of the file and the validity of the path. If valid, it reads the specified byte range from the file and returns the data. The method responds with appropriate HTTP status codes and messages for various error conditions such as invalid paths, file not found, or illegal byte range requests.
      Parameters:
      exchange - The HTTP exchange context, encapsulating the request and response details.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading from the file or sending the response.

    • handleStorageSize

      private void handleStorageSize(HttpExchange exchange) throws IOException
      Handles a request to retrieve the size of a specific file stored on the server. This method listens for HTTP requests querying the size of a file. Upon receiving a request, it parses the file path from the request body and validates its existence within the server's root directory. If the file exists, the method responds with the file size in bytes. Otherwise, it handles errors such as invalid paths or non-existent files by responding with appropriate HTTP status codes and messages.
      Parameters:
      exchange - The HTTP exchange context, providing a means to access request data and send responses.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while processing the request or sending the response.

    • handleStorageCreate

      private void handleStorageCreate(HttpExchange exchange) throws IOException
      Handles the storage create request. This method processes an incoming HTTP create request, extracting the file path from the request body. It validates the existence of the file and the validity of the path. If valid, it creates the file at the specified path. Responses vary based on the operation's success or failure, including file already exists, illegal path, or illegal method errors.
      Parameters:
      exchange - The HTTP exchange context, containing the request and response details.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during the create operation or while sending the response.

    • handleStorageDelete

      private void handleStorageDelete(HttpExchange exchange) throws IOException
      Handles the storage delete request.
      Parameters:
      exchange - The HttpExchange object representing the request and response.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • registerWithNamingServer

      private void registerWithNamingServer()
      Registers the storage server with the naming server, advertising its file storage capabilities. This method compiles a list of all files currently stored on this server and sends a registration request to the naming server. The request includes the server's IP address, client and command port numbers, and the list of files. Upon successful registration, the server may receive instructions to delete certain files if they are deemed unnecessary by the naming server, ensuring synchronization with the system's current state. If the registration process encounters any errors, such as an inability to connect to the naming server or problems listing the local files, the method will log these issues and halt the registration process.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method to start the storage server.
      Parameters:
      args - Command line arguments.

    • sendResponse

      private void sendResponse(HttpExchange exchange, int statusCode, Object responseBody) throws IOException
      Sends an HTTP response with the specified status code and response body.
      Parameters:
      exchange - The HTTP exchange context to send the response.
      statusCode - The status code of the response.
      responseBody - The body of the response.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while sending the response.
